result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny M Fernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 
35 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor.
Court advised defendant he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 2 years of Initial Confinement.

Restitution set at zero.  Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/24/20; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/24/20; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny M Fernandez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS ATTN. RECORDS 2909 E PARK AVE. CHIPPEWA FALLS WI 54729

- signed and filed.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 35 Judge Judge Rosa. os
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Denying Motion for Reconsideration signed and filed. Copy sent to the defendant. sab
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for reconsideration.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 06/26/14. AR
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Johnny M Fernandez in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 35 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. after 2 years of Initial Confinement.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/24/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/24/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Johnny M Fernandez in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted fleon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 6/24/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Attorney Guimont is going to be out of town for the plea date. Plea rescheduled for 4/28/2014 at 8:30 am. sab

Defendant Johnny M Fernandez in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is out of custody, therefore defense withdraws theor bail motion. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 4/16/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

2/12/14 vf

Attorney Vincent Guimont in court, defendant Johnny M Fernandez not in court, in custody.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Court waived defendant's appearance.  Defense counsel requests case be set for bail/bond hearing and status conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 15.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Johnny M Fernandez in court with Joseph Riepenhoff, student intern under the supervision of attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Johnny M Fernandez in custody.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rakelle Z., Jason K., Tracy P. and Anthony I.

Defendant Johnny M Fernandez in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Johnny M Fernandez in custody.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
